rComments: EASIEST CLASS EVER. As long as you attend every class and take notes, you'll do well. She is very understanding and engaging. However, the topics were boring at times. This class is a hidden gem in the myucsc portal (It's always available fall quarter). I highly recommend for a GPA boost and a GE fulfillment.

What was really annoying about this course was that there was no book, so all the information was taken from Tanya's lectures. Her powerpoint slides were vague and she often rambles on the entire class time about the artists. Be sure to pay attention and take good notes. However, her tests and assignments were extremely easy!
Really easy class! Show up and do some extra studying and you will pass. The lectures are pretty interesting for the most part and Tanya has a lot of knowledge and is very respectable.
She was more interested in telling personal (boring) stories than actually teaching. Don't take this class if you can't sit through lecture without sleeping or using a phone.

Extremely easy course. There were a few times were lectures were interesting, typically in the first unit. Majority of the time she wasted time talking about a few terms instead of focusing on music examples and interesting information. I enjoyed her class the first unit, the last two were pretty terrible...
Loved this class! Got 103% in the whole class and got the highest score. Just go to every class and study.

Every second of this class was agony. The prof spends most of class time telling students to put their phones away, which is so much more distracting than some kid on a phone. You will not learn anything in this class, seriously don't waste your time

Do not take this class. The professor is pathetic, she rants on about personal stories about people calling her fat every lecture. She takes half the lecture to go over 2 definitions. She spends the other half of the lecture calling out people who are on their phones.

Her study guides are completely unhelpful. She basically just gives out a bunch of terms and expects you to know them as well as she does. The lecture notes are not helpful, her slides have information but that information isn't helpful unless you listen to every single word she says in class. She has a vendetta against electronics.

Even though I had to write a lot of essays for this class, Professor was very helpful and available at her office hours.We didn't even have a textbook for our class, but if you attend the lecture and learn the terms in her power point slides, you will do well!

The class was super interesing and easy if you study your lecture notes.  All tests are multiple choice.  The second unit is probably the worst, all the songs sound the same.  She is really esay to comfort and a nice person.  Good teacher too for someone who has no musical background.

This was the worst music class I have ever taken at UCSC. She has no idea how to teach non music majors world music. Tests were incredibly hard and she required us to learn tons of terms that couldnt be pronounced. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS
Used slides from previous years including typos, reading terms then playing examples to class.  Homework is easy and tests are detailed.  Lecture is extremely boring

She is lazy and really strict on her policies. She does not allow any electronic devices and she makes sure her TA goes around and check if people are using any electronic devices. She tries to talk smart and likes to use fancy words

Interesting class, but MAKE SURE YOU TAKE NOTES. The midterm and final are all on lecture material, and if you study your notes/the listening examples, you'll be fine. There are no sections for this class! I definitely recommend it, easy A if you're willing to put in any effort.

Lectures were a snoozefest, but I did spend a fair amount of studying. I got a B on the first midterm, a C on the final and ended up with an A in the course. Just make sure you get all the easy points, like attendance, discussion, etc.

Tanya is a great teacher. She explains things really well, her lectures are very interesting, and she really cares about the subject. This class was very easy to succeed in, and she made the material fascinating.
Lectures dragged on, but easy to get a good grade if you pay attention in class and go to all the lectures. Do all the assignments and you will be fine. Minimal outside work. She's kinda funny

Although it fulfills many GEs, do not take this class!!! Lectures were usually very boring, were only occasionally interesting, and she tries to cover too many topics at once. Midterm/final were very very very difficult!!! Average grade was a D. Amount of material/vocabulary that she expects you to know for the tests is absolutely ridiculous.
A very nice professor. Gives very good lectures but would help if she covers everything that goes in the test instead of relying on the book.

I know this class may be tempting because of the multiple GE's but I would seriously think hard before taking this course. I fell asleep in class almost every lecture from the pure boredom. It was kind of ridiculous how much material she wanted us to memorize and she was not a very friendly person. An A is possible with effort, just bring a pillow.

Prof. Merchant was very enthusiastic, but had no clue how to teach 400 non-music majors. A waste of a class, I was hoping to learn something but the class went too fast and was horribly structured. She only focused on instruments and sound terms, neglecting influences and cultural relations. Also why where there 4 TAs. They counted notecards!!!!

I would absolutely NOT recommend taking her Intro to  World Music class. She had no idea how to convey the ideas of world music to non-music majors. The course consists of memorizing hundreds of instruments and reading her error-ridden powerpoints. She doesn't put much effort into her job! And she loves to talk to herself in front of 400 people.

DO NOT take this class, even if you are just looking to get GE's. She is an extremely boring teacher and her lectures are just her reading the exact words from the book. I showed up to every class and studied for the midterm for hours and still got a D on the test (she said the class average was a D yet only only curved the test 4 points!)

She is a GREAT professor, really knows her stuff, really enthusiastic about the subject (Women in Music). She is sincerely interested in helping you learn. The assignments compliment the class, and the mini quizzes help prepare you for the midterms, which are simple if you attend class. The final was a group project, which wasn't so bad.
